intro: Vernonia quadriflora, commonly known as the four-flower ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are sturdy and often reddish in color. Vernonia quadriflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
